page.title: 01Bondleigh, Landscape.
page.content: {Part of North Tawton,}the South area Bouchiers Hill, with late 19th century houses, modern bungalows to West, new development to East, leads out into undulating farming country, the main feature of area, through deep Devon lanes to{Bondleigh,}a small village with cluster of cottages, some 17c., and old Mill by Bridge, across which a lane climbs to Church and Barton. The meandering {River Taw}intersects West of area spanned by White Clapper, Yeo and Bondleigh Bridge, the latter the only tarmac vehicular road crossing. From its East bank North of Yeo Farm a thatched cob longhouse, Cottles wood clothes the steeply rising slope.{Rook (mainly oak/ash) and{Ashridge woods } (deciduou/scrub), stretch to{Horse {Park Copse}forming{Ashridge Estate } surrounding Ashridge Court and Farm, approximately l9th century.
